name: CellCept
indications: cellcept [ mycophenolate mofetil ( mmf ) ] indicated prophylaxis organ rejection , adult pediatric recipients 3 months age older allogeneic kidney [ ( 14.1 ) ] , heart [ ( 14.2 ) ] liver transplants [ ( 14.3 ) ] , combination immunosuppressants .
contraindications: adults kidney transplant 1 g twice daily , orally intravenously ( iv ) less 2 h ( 2.2 ) heart transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally iv , less 2 h ( 2.3 ) liver transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally 1g twice daily iv less 2 h ( 2.4 ) pediatrics kidney transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily , maximum 2 g daily ( 2.2 ) heart transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily ( starting dose ) maximum 900 mg/m 2 twice daily ( 3 g 15 ml oral suspension ) ( 2.3 ) liver transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily ( starting dose ) maximum 900 mg/m 2 twice daily ( 3 g 15 ml oral suspension ) ( 2.4 ) cellcept intravenous alternative patients tolerate oral medication . administer within 24 hours following transplantation , patients tolerate oral medication , 14 days . ( 2.1 ) reduce interrupt dosing event neutropenia . ( 2.5 ) full prescribing information ( fpi ) : adjustments renal impairment neutropenia ( 2.5 ) , preparation oral suspension iv solution . ( 2.6 )
adverseReactions: cellcept contraindicated patients history hypersensitivity , including anaphylaxis , mycophenolate mofetil ( mmf ) , mycophenolic acid ( mpa ) component product [ ( 5.8 ) ] . cellcept intravenous contraindicated patients allergic polysorbate 80 ( tween ) .
indications_original: CELLCEPT [mycophenolate mofetil (MMF)] is indicated for the prophylaxis of organ rejection, in adult and pediatric recipients 3 months of age and older of allogeneic kidney [see Clinical Studies (14.1)], heart [see Clinical Studies (14.2)] or liver transplants [see Clinical Studies (14.3)], in combination with other immunosuppressants.
contraindications_original: ADULTS DOSAGE Kidney Transplant 1 g twice daily, orally or intravenously (IV) over no less than 2 h ( 2.2 ) Heart Transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally or IV, over no less than 2 h ( 2.3 ) Liver Transplant 1.5 g twice daily orally or 1g twice daily IV over no less than 2 h ( 2.4 ) PEDIATRICS Kidney Transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily, up to maximum of 2 g daily ( 2.2 ) Heart Transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily (starting dose) up to a maximum of  900 mg/m 2 twice daily (3 g or 15 mL of oral suspension) ( 2.3 ) Liver Transplant 600 mg/m 2 orally twice daily (starting dose) up to a maximum of  900 mg/m 2 twice daily (3 g or 15 mL of oral suspension) ( 2.4 ) CELLCEPT Intravenous is an alternative when patients cannot tolerate oral medication. Administer within 24 hours following transplantation, until patients can tolerate oral medication, up to 14 days. ( 2.1 ) Reduce or interrupt dosing in the event of neutropenia. ( 2.5 ) See full prescribing information (FPI) for: adjustments for renal impairment and neutropenia ( 2.5 ), preparation of oral suspension and IV solution. ( 2.6 )
adverseReactions_original: CELLCEPT is contraindicated in patients with a history of hypersensitivity, including anaphylaxis, to mycophenolate mofetil (MMF), mycophenolic acid (MPA) or any component of the drug product [see Warnings and Precautions (5.8)]. CELLCEPT Intravenous is contraindicated in patients who are allergic to Polysorbate 80 (TWEEN).
